extendedIngredients.name: avocado
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 large ripe avocado, halved and seed removed

extendedIngredients.name: black beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cups black beans, drained and rinsed

extendedIngredients.name: jalapeno pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 tablespoons jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely diced

recipes.title: Corn & Black Bean Taquitos with Creamy Avocado Dip

winePairing.pairingText: Mexican works really well with Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Sparkling rosé. Acidic white wines like riesling or low-tannin reds like pinot noir can work well with Mexican dishes. Sparkling rosé is a safe pairing too. The Garnet Monterey Pinot Noir with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 16 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Garnet Monterey Pinot Noir
productMatches.description: This is a Pinot with power, but also with finesse. Aromas include ripe blackberries, cherry preserves, vanilla toffee and toasted French oak. You'll love the velvety richness of the attack. The flavors of dark red fruits and exotic spices just make this a juicy, delicious mouthful of wine.

recipes.instructions: To make the avocado dip, add the avocado, soymilk, lime juice, and adobo seasoning to a food processor or blender. Blend until smooth and creamy, about 3 minutes. Feel free to add more soymilk if you prefer a thinner dip. Set aside.For the taquitos, preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper.Heat the olive oil in a fry pan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until translucent, about 2 minutes. Add the black beans and corn to the pan. In a small bowl, stir together the taco seasoning and water. Pour over the black bean mixture and stir until well-coated. Stir in the jalapeno. Remove the mixture from the heat.Warm the tortillas in the microwave covered in a damp paper towel for about 30 seconds. Take about 2 tablespoons of the black bean mixture and place down the middle of a tortilla. Roll the tortilla up nice and tight and place seam-side down on the cookie sheet. Repeat with remaining tortillas. Spray each one with cooking spray. Bake for about 10 minutes, then flip and continue baking until lightly golden, about 5-10 minutes. Serve the creamy avocado dip.

steps.step: To make the avocado dip, add the avocado, soymilk, lime juice, and adobo seasoning to a food processor or blender. Blend until smooth and creamy, about 3 minutes. Feel free to add more soymilk if you prefer a thinner dip. Set aside.For the taquitos, preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper.
Heat the olive oil in a fry pan over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until translucent, about 2 minutes.
Add the black beans and corn to the pan. In a small bowl, stir together the taco seasoning and water.
Pour over the black bean mixture and stir until well-coated. Stir in the jalapeno.

Remove the mixture from the heat.Warm the tortillas in the microwave covered in a damp paper towel for about 30 seconds. Take about 2 tablespoons of the black bean mixture and place down the middle of a tortilla.
Roll the tortilla up nice and tight and place seam-side down on the cookie sheet. Repeat with remaining tortillas. Spray each one with cooking spray.
Bake for about 10 minutes, then flip and continue baking until lightly golden, about 5-10 minutes.
